instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-02016: What is 820-02016? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  water damage smoked M1  I miss the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> days!"
threads.message:
Seems the new M1 Air's are no different than their previous models.   The backlight power is right next to <SIGNAL>LPDT_INT</SIGNAL> data lines that run straight to the M1.
I total so many new MacBook logic boards for water damage or surges that find their way to the T2 or the processor it is depressing.

Am I  a bad tech?  Am I the only one that is getting discouraged with these failures?
I bet I have to let 20-40% go to the bone pile.   I miss the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> days!   I never totaled those!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  water damage smoked M1  I miss the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> days!"
threads.message:
Apple found a "good" way to burn the machines voiding warranty fix.
Almost any liquid spill ends with dead board...
